data.markdowntyper#MarkdownTyper:
Declarative component that accepts content via children.
<MarkdownTyper interval={20}>
  # Hello World
</MarkdownTyper>
data.documentation-navigation#Documentation N:
Props - All available props
Methods - Component methods
Types - TypeScript types

data.markdowntyper-methods#MarkdownTyper Meth:
Access via ref:
const ref = useRef<MarkdownTyperRef>(null);
ref.current?.start();     // Start typing
ref.current?.stop();       // Pause typing
ref.current?.resume();     // Resume typing
ref.current?.restart();    // Restart
data.markdowntypercmd-methods#MarkdownTyperCM:
Access via ref:
const cmdRef = useRef<MarkdownTyperCMDRef>(null);
cmdRef.current?.push(content);    // Add content
cmdRef.current?.clear();         // Clear
cmdRef.current?.start();          // Start
cmdRef.current?.stop();           // Pause
cmdRef.current?.resume();         // Resume
cmdRef.current?.restart();         // Restart
cmdRef.current?.triggerWholeEnd(); // Manually trigger end
data.pushcontent#push(content):
Add content and start typing.
cmdRef.current?.push('# Hello World\n\nThis is content');
Parameters:
content: string - Markdown content to add
data.clear#clear():
Clear all content and state.
cmdRef.current?.clear();

data.markdowntyper-props#MarkdownTyper Props: Prop	Type	Default	Description	children	string	-	Markdown content (required)	interval	number | IntervalType	30	Typing interval (milliseconds)	timerType	'setTimeout' | 'requestAnimationFrame'	'setTimeout'	Timer type	showCursor	boolean	false	Whether to show cursor	cursor	React.ReactNode	"|"	Cursor content	showCursorOnPause	boolean	true	Whether to show cursor when paused	disableTyping	boolean	false	Disable typing animation	autoStartTyping	boolean	true	Auto start typing	onStart	(data) => void	-	Typing start callback	onEnd	(data) => void	-	Typing end callback	onTypedChar	(data) => void	-	Callback after each character	onBeforeTypedChar	(data) => Promise<void>	-	Callback before each character	reactMarkdownProps	Options	-	react-markdown configuration	customConvertMarkdownString	(str: string) => string	-	Custom Markdown conversion function
data.markdowntypercmd-props#MarkdownTyperCMD: Same as MarkdownTyper, but doesn't require children.

data.itypedchar#ITypedChar:
Typed character callback data type:
interface ITypedChar {
  currentIndex: number;    // Current character index
  currentChar: string;     // Current character
  prevStr: string;         // Previous string
  currentStr: string;      // Current full string
  percent: number;        // Progress percentage
}
data.ibeforetypedchar#IBeforeTypedChar:
Before typing callback data type:
interface IBeforeTypedChar {
  currentIndex: number;    // Current character index
  currentChar: string;     // Current character
  prevStr: string;        // Previous string
  percent: number;        // Progress percentage
}

data.control-typing-speed#Control Typing Spee:
// Fast typing
<MarkdownTyper interval={10}>
  Content...
</MarkdownTyper>
// Slow typing
<MarkdownTyper interval={100}>
  Content...
</MarkdownTyper>

data: Here are various usage examples for react-markdown-typer.
data.basic-examples#Basic Examples:
Basic Usage - Simplest usage
Streaming Data - Handle AI streaming responses
Typing Animation - Custom typing effects
data.view-all-examples#View All Examples:
Clone the repository to see all examples:
git clone https://github.com/onshinpei/react-markdown-typer.git
cd react-markdown-typer
npm install
npm run dev
Example locations:
example/basic/ - Basic usage
example/cmd/ - Imperative API
example/cursor/ - Cursor effects
example/katex/ - Math formulas

data: Examples for handling AI streaming responses.
Examples for custom typing animation effects.
data.disable-animation#Disable Animation:
const [disable, setDisable] = useState(false);
<MarkdownTyper disableTyping={disable}>
  Content will display immediately without animation
</MarkdownTyper>
data.manual-control#Manual Control:
const ref = useRef<MarkdownTyperRef>(null);
<>
  <button onClick={() => ref.current?.start()}>Start</button>
  <button onClick={() => ref.current?.stop()}>Pause</button>
  <button onClick={() => ref.current?.resume()}>Resume</button>
  <button onClick={() => ref.current?.restart()}>Restart</button>
  
  <MarkdownTyper 
    ref={ref}
    autoStartTyping={false}
    interval={30}
  >
    Content...
  </MarkdownTyper>
</>

data.control-animation#Control Animation:
const cmdRef = useRef<MarkdownTyperCMDRef>(null);
// Control methods
cmdRef.current?.start();     // Start
cmdRef.current?.stop();       // Pause
cmdRef.current?.resume();     // Resume
cmdRef.current?.restart();    // Restart
cmdRef.current?.clear();     // Clear
data.typing-speed#Typing Speed:
Control typing speed via interval (milliseconds):
// Fast typing
<MarkdownTyper interval={10}>
  Content...
</MarkdownTyper>
// Slow typing
<MarkdownTyper interval={100}>
  Content...
</MarkdownTyper>

data.optimized-for-ai-applications#Optimized: Automatic Streaming Data SplittingDo regular typewriters stutter with AI streaming data? We don't. Automatically splits each chunk into characters, ensuring smooth character-by-character rendering no matter how much the backend pushes at once.
data.lightweight-yet-powerful#Lightweight yet:
Built on industry-standard react-markdown
Zero additional dependencies, works out of the box
Full Markdown syntax support
data.complete-typing-control#Complete Typing:
Not just playing animations, but also:
Pause - stop()
Resume - resume()
Restart - restart()
Clear - clear()
Full imperative API gives you complete control.
data.plugin-ecosystem-compatible#Plugin Ecosy:
Compatible with the entire remark/rehype plugin ecosystem:
Code highlighting (rehype-highlight)
Math formulas (remark-math, rehype-katex)
GitHub Flavored Markdown (remark-gfm)
Tables, task lists, and more
data.typing-cursor#Typing Cursor:
Supports string cursor
Supports custom ReactNode cursor
Optional show/hide when paused
data.typescript-support#TypeScript Support:
Complete type definitions
IntelliSense
Type safety
data.production-ready#Production Ready:
Well tested
Performance optimized
Well documented

data: Welcome to react-markdown-typer! This guide will help you get started quickly.
data.installation#Installation:
First, install react-markdown-typer:
npm install react-markdown-typer
data.next-steps#Next Steps:
Learn Basic Usage
Explore Typing Cursor
Check Core Features

data.requirements#Requirements:
React 16.8+ or higher
Node.js 14.0+ or higher

data.string-cursor#String Cursor:
Simplest cursor style:
<MarkdownTyperCMD 
  showCursor={true}
  cursor="|"
/>
Supports any string:
<MarkdownTyperCMD 
  showCursor={true}
  cursor="‚ñã"
/>

data:
üöÄ React Markdown Typing Animation Component
A React component designed for modern AI applications, providing smooth real-time typing animations and full Markdown rendering capabilities.If you need styling, support for math formulas, and mermaid chart rendering, we recommend ds-markdown
data.optimized-for-ai-applications#Optimized: Do regular typewriters stutter with AI streaming data? We don't. Automatically splits each chunk into characters, ensuring smooth character-by-character rendering no matter how much the backend pushes at once.
data.lightweight-yet-powerful#Lightweight yet:
Built on industry-standard react-markdown
Zero additional dependencies, works out of the box
data.complete-typing-control#Complete Typing: Not just playing animations, but also pause, resume, restart, and clear. Full imperative API gives you complete control.
data.plugin-ecosystem-compatible#Plugin Ecosy: Compatible with the entire remark/rehype plugin ecosystem, easily extend functionality. Supports code highlighting, math formulas, tables, custom cursors, and more.
data.production-ready#Production Ready:
Native TypeScript support
Complete type definitions
Use CasesAI Chat Assistants ¬∑ Real-time Q&A Systems ¬∑ Online Education Platforms ¬∑ Product Demos ¬∑ Interactive Documentation ¬∑ Knowledge Base Display
data.installation#Installation:
‚ÑπÔ∏è Note: Requires React 16.8+ or higher
# npm
npm install react-markdown-typer
# yarn
yarn add react-markdown-typer
# pnpm
pnpm add react-markdown-typer
data.next-steps#Next Steps:
Read Get Started to learn basic usage
Check API Reference to see all configuration options
Browse Examples to see real-world use cases
data.related-projects#Related Projects:
ds-markdown - If you need a styled markdown typing component
react-markdown - Markdown rendering core
